Tonya Robinson, BM'DE çıkarlarımızın temsil edilmesi için dişe diş mücadele edecek bir vatansever olarak tanınıyor. Vatansever ve daha muhafazakar vatandaşlar arasında popüler bir seçim olarak görülüyor, tarihsel olarak dış yardıma karşı ve ithalat tarifelerinin destekçisi. Uluslararası alanda popüler değil.

Dennis Gonzales, uzlaşma ve anlayış yoluyla zor sorunları çözme ününe sahip uluslararası sahnede popüler bir figür. Gerçek bir enternasyonalist, toplumumuzdaki liberaller ve sosyalistler ile yabancı liderler arasında popülerdir.

En kıdemli ve saygın yargıçlarımızdan biri öldü ve şimdi onun yerine aday gösterilen adaylar arasında bir seçim yapmamız gerekiyor. Bu kişi mahkemelerimizde çok uzun süre oturacak, bu yüzden doğru kararı vermeliyiz.

Edgar Lopez, insan haklarının güçlü bir destekçisi oldu ve bireylerin hakları ve özgürlükleri lehine birçok dönüm noktası kararı aldı. Ayrıca güçlü bir tüketici yanlısı olarak görülüyor ve büyük şirketlere meydan okumaktan korkmuyor.

Alice Reed, şiddet içeren suçlarla ilgili birçok ünlü kararı ve hırsızlara, soygunculara ve hırsızlara uygulanması gerektiğini düşündüğü sert cezalara ilişkin sık sık açık sözlü görüşleri sayesinde bir ev adıdır.

Süper popüler bir ünlü evleniyor ve siz misafirlerden biri olarak davetlisiniz. Bu normalde hiçbir şekilde tartışmalı olmazdı, ancak bu aynı cinsiyetten bir çift ve ünlü LGBT haklarının tanınmış bir savunucusu. Katılacak mısın?

Elbette katılmalı ve bunu gururla yapmalı ve davet için teşekkür etmelisin. 21. yüzyıl ve düğünlerine katıldığı insanların cinsel yönelimi nedeniyle bir politikacıyı daha az düşünecek insanların gerçekten zamana ayak uydurması gerekiyor. Bunun bir sorun olması bile utanç verici.

Gelin veya damadı ne kadar iyi tanıyor olurlarsa olsunlar, bir siyasi liderin her ünlü düğünde görünmesi açıkça zorunlu değildir. Ülkeyi yönetmek tam zamanlı bir iştir ve o gün ilgilenmeniz gereken bazı önemli devlet meseleleriniz olursa, o zaman herkes katılamayacağınızı anlayacaktır.

Ülkemizin en iyi tiyatrosunda şu anda çok iyi karşılanan ve popüler bir oyun devam ediyor. Yönetmen sizi bir gösteriye katılmaya davet etti. Bu bir sorun olmayacak, ancak oyun toplumun LGBT topluluğundakilere karşı tutumlarına dair bir yorum. Oyuna katılmanın LGBT hareketine güçlü bir sempati gösterdiği görülecektir.

Oyuna katılmanın hiçbir maliyeti olmadığı veya herhangi bir yasayı içermediği, ancak LGBT topluluğuna biraz ilgi ve sempati göstermenize izin verdiği için bu politik olarak kolay bir kazanç. Daveti geri çevirmek tatsız olurdu.

Yolunuza çıkan her daveti kabul etmek zorunda değilsiniz. Yönetmen açıkça alaycı ve alaycı olan gündemine bir destek gösterisi zorlamak için daveti alaycı bir şekilde kullanmaya çalışıyor. Oyuna katılmamak tamamen makul bir cevaptır.

Ülkenin en büyük çelik fabrikalarından biri olan Stargazy Steelworks Inc, ciddi mali zorluklarla karşı karşıya kaldı ve batmanın eşiğinde. Şirket yöneticileri, hükümetin önümüzdeki birkaç ay boyunca çalışmalarını sağlamak için faizsiz bir kredi sağlaması durumunda yeni siparişler alabileceklerini ve şirketi devam ettirebileceklerini düşünüyor.

Bu şirket binlerce kişiyi istihdam ediyor ve onlara hizmet veren ve şirketin batması durumunda da etkilenecek birçok başka şirket var. Bu şirketin kapanmasına izin verirsek bunun yerel ekonomi üzerindeki etkisini bir düşünün. Vergisiz bir kredi vermeliyiz.

Buna serbest piyasa denir. Şirket karlı olmadığı için batıyor. Onlara borç para vermek mantıklı olsaydı, özel sektör bunu yapardı. Bu sadece kötüden sonra iyi para atmak. Elbette kısa vadeli işsizlik olacak, ancak serbest piyasa ile savaşamazsınız.

Açıkçası bu şirketin başarısız olmasını istemiyoruz, ancak vergi mükelleflerine karşılığında hiçbir şey olmayan özel bir işletmeye nakit para vermek aptalca. Onları kurtaralım, ancak bir koşul olarak işteki azınlık hissesini ele geçirelim.

Dindar bir çiftin sahibi olduğu bir fırıncı, kiliselerinin eşcinselliği onaylamadığı göz önüne alındığında, aynı cinsiyetten bir çift için dini gerekçelerle kutlama pastası pişirmeyi reddettikten sonra ayrımcılık nedeniyle mahkemeye çıkarıldı. Bu gibi durumlarda yasanın açıkça açıklığa kavuşturulması gerekir.

Elbette, istemediğiniz geleneği geri çevirebileceğiniz bir işi yürütmenin temel ilkesi bu mu? Bir müşteriyi rencide etmemek için insanları küfürlü buldukları işler üretmeye gerçekten zorlayacak mıyız? Pastayı mutlu bir şekilde pişirecek başka birçok fırıncı olduğu için bu açık bir provokasyon.

Ayrımcılık, dini ne olursa olsun ayrımcılıktır. İnsanların, yasalarla çelişse bile, müşterileri dini nedenlerle geri çevirebileceklerini iddia etmelerine izin verirsek, bu çok kaygan bir eğimdir. Çiftin yaşam tarzını onaylamakta özgürdürler, ancak onlarla iş yapmayı meşru bir şekilde reddedemezler.

Televizyonda alkol reklamını yasaklayan bir yasa önerisi var. Radyo, reklam panoları ve diğer yollarla reklam vermek yasal kalsa da, TV yasağı vatandaşlarımızın alkol alımını azaltmanın potansiyel bir yolu olarak görülüyor.

Bu yasa delilik. Ya bir ürünü yasaklıyorsunuz ya da yasaklamıyorsunuz. Alkol tamamen yasaldır ve milyonlarca vatandaş tarafından kötü etkisi olmaksızın kullanılmaktadır. Bir ürünün belirli bir ortamda reklamını yasaklamak, alkol karşıtı fanatikler için serbest piyasaya müdahale etmekten başka hiçbir şey yapmayan sembolik bir jesttir.

Bir gecede alkolizmi durdurmayabilir, ancak TV reklam yasağı doğru yönde atılmış bir adımdır. Reklamverenler, ürünlerini gençlik pazarında pazarlamaya yönelik endişe verici bir eğilimle reklamlarında giderek daha agresif davranıyorlar. Alkol tüketimini azaltmak için yapabileceğimiz her şey denemeye değer.

Tüm hayvan deneylerini yasaklama önerisi, baskı grupları tarafından hükümetin önüne getirildi. Şu anda hayvan testi kullanan endüstrilerde çalışan epeyce insanımız var, ancak bu aynı zamanda oldukça popüler olmayan bir uygulamadır.

Bu gün ve yaşta hayvanlar üzerinde, özellikle kozmetikler üzerinde herhangi bir ürünü test etmek için iyi bir neden yok. Kullanılan uygulamalar genellikle inanılmaz derecede acımasızdır ve bir yasağın yaygın halk desteği ve endüstri üzerinde çok az gerçek etkisi olacaktır.

Sonuç olarak rakip firmalar bu bisikletlerden on binlercesini şehir merkezlerimizin her yerine dağıttılar. Sakinler, genellikle sokaklarda rastgele terk edildikleri için karmaşaya kızgınlar. column6: and is a classic example of the government interfering where it is not needed. Can't we just let people make their own decisions as to which restroom is appropriate?"

column4: A number of large agricultural companies are interested in growing genetically modified (GM) food on our soil. Some food can be genetically manipulated to allow for longer shelf life and both disease and herbicide resistance. Opponents are concerned about the potential risks associated with altering the food chain. Farmers are divided on the issue.
"GM crops have huge potential benefits. Not only do they increase shelf life and thus reduce costs for the sellers
column5: but they can also reduce the need for pesticides
column6: thus meaning less harmful chemicals in use during their production. It's also possible for foods to be created with other benefits such as improved vitamin content."

column4: "There is no need for GM food. The benefits are great for the producers
column5: but not for the consumers. We simply do not know enough about the long term effects of genetically modifying the food chain. Scientific research is all well and good
column6: but once released into the environment
column7: these organisms cannot be recalled. We should act now to protect the food chain from GM."

column3: Kritik sistemleri ihlal eden bilgisayar korsanları
column4: "A group of expert hackers has hacked critical systems in our computer networks
column5: including power plants and banking. The group went public and admitted to the hack
column6: pointing out some dangerous flaws in our defenses and offering ways to fix the problems. Companies and security experts are now on high alert and demand action."

column3: Bu suçluları tutuklayın."Hacking these systems could have caused a catastrophe. The flaws in the system need to be fixed as quickly as possible and the hackers arrested
column4: otherwise other hackers will attempt this again
column5: causing immense stress on our networks in the hopes of becoming famous."

column3: Onları işe al."These hackers seem to be the best in their field
column4: so they should be perfect to keep our systems safe and work on new methods to prevent future incidents like that. Companies and state-employees won't like it
column5: but security comes first here."

column4: "A group of religious extremists have taken some hostages at gunpoint and are threatening to kill them unless demands regarding foreign policy are not met. The demands they make are not that extreme
column5: but it might be dangerous to be seen to negotiate."

column4: The best thing we can do here is to be reasonable and give in at least partially to their demands. That way we can ensure nobody gets hurt, and the situation doesn't spiral out of control. Taking extreme action against these people could only cause racial tension.

column3: Polisi çağır."There is no negotiating with hostage takers. To do so would open the floodgates to total chaos. Its unfortunate for those citizens taken hostage
column4: but we need to storm the building right now and try and get those people freed. If that means shooting the hostage takers and losing a few hostages
column5: that's the price we have to pay."

column4: "There is a shortage of homes in our country
column5: and the government is under pressure to relax planning laws and allow previously restricted 'green-belt' land to be built on."

column4: "House prices  are rising far faster than earnings
column5: due mainly to the shortage of supply. In the long term
column6: the only solution is to build more housing. It's no good providing housing where there are no jobs
column7: and if that means building on a small proportion of 'green-belt' land then that's a price we have to pay."

column4: "There is always pressure to build new homes on 'green field sites'
column5: because housing companies find it cheaper and easier to build on them. There are plenty of urban sites that should be reused before we resort to carving up the countryside. A sudden expansion into the green belt would have a dreadful impact on the rural communities."

column4: A convicted terrorist has gone on hunger strike demanding he be allowed visits from people thought to be associated with terrorist groups. We do not have the evidence to arrest his colleagues, and are currently banning all visits for this prisoner, but it looks like he will go through with his hunger strike threat and may well die in his cell.
"We might not like this man or what he stands for but we cannot allow him to die in a cell. Doing so would only reduce us to the level of the terrorist
column5: and would also almost certainly make a martyr out of him. We should let him have visitors whilst in prison."

column4: You do not negotiate with terrorists. Its as simple as that. They will only perceive any negotiation or relaxation of the rules on our part as a sign of weakness. If he dies in prison, then that's his decision and we should not be concerned.
"Everyone knows we have illegal immigrants in our country. A proposal has been put that we should offer existing immigrants an amnesty and welcome them as proper citizens
column5: who can work and pay tax like anybody else."

column4: "An amnesty might be tempting for tax and law-and-order reasons
column5: but it sends a terrible message. People who broke our laws and came here illegally should never be rewarded for doing so. This would just lead to yet more illegal immigration from people hoping the same happens to them."

column4: "However tough or relaxed we are on current immigration policy
column5: it doesn't change the status of people already here. Many illegal immigrants have worked and lived here for years
column6: and it simply makes economic sense
column7: and improves social cohesion to grant them citizenship. That means less black-market work

column4: "There is currently a proposal to increase the rights of tenants in rented accommodation. The fear of being suddenly thrown out of your home
column5: or having your rent raised to unaffordable levels
column6: or waiting ages for repairs is making rented accommodation extremely undesirable and tenants are demanding something is done."

column4: "The rental market is a good example of a free market
column5: where landlords will compete for the best tenants
column6: and tenants can pick and choose their homes based on price
column7: location and reputation. There is no need for further burdensome legislation here. If tenants find a landlord to be offering bad service
column8: they are free to move to other premises."

column4: Many people simply cannot afford the deposit to buy a house and are resigned to renting their whole lives. the lack of decent protections from random eviction or rent increases mean these people never have the peace of mind or stability that homeowners enjoy. Landlords who take their duties seriously have nothing to fear from sensible improvements to the law.

There are concerns that school standards are slipping and that the current regime for examining teaching methods and schools is not sufficient. Campaigners suggest a toughening up of the system with much more frequent inspections.

Education is a service like any other, and its essential that parents know what they are getting for their money or taxes. Decent teachers should have nothing to fear from extra scrutiny. What parent would oppose greater checks on the way in which their children were being educated?
"Teaching children is difficult enough as it is
column5: as well as being poorly paid and undertaken by dedicated professionals. This proposal would simply heap extra bureaucracy and take more time away from actual teaching. Its insulting to suggest that dedicated public service workers like teachers need further scrutiny."

column4: "The increasing capability of large corporations to use customer databases and 'big data' to analyze consumer behavior has led to concerns about privacy. The companies insist that such data is anonymous in many cases and is being used purely to provide a better service
column5: whereas campaigners suggest big faceless corporations are creating 'big brother' style databases of consumers without their consent."

column4: "This sort of behavior is nothing short of creepy
column5: as well as posing a potential risk of identity theft for consumers. Companies have managed well enough all these years without tracking and storing information on every single decision a customer makes
column6: and can easily get by without it. People have the right to buy things without effectively being followed by digital spies wherever they go."

column4: "Opponents of internet tracking make it sound far more sinister than it is. All we are talking about is allowing companies to record accurate information on consumer preferences so they can make better products and target their advertising effectively
column5: something that is harmless and also essential to a modern economy. There is no real cry for the government to intervene here."

column3: Kullanıcıları Uyarın."Banning tracking goes too far
column4: but its important that citizens are aware when they are being tracked. maybe a system of convenient pop-up windows when visiting a website that tell people they are being tracked is the best solution for everybody?"
"As more people switch to telephone or Internet banking
column5: the major banks are closing small rural branches. These branches are still used by many elderly people in rural communities
column6: and campaigners want the government to force these rural banks to stay open."

column3: Bankaları açık kalmaya zorlayın."To younger people
column4: bank branches may seem redundant
column5: but many older citizens actually prefer to use their local banks
column6: which also serve as a vital part of rural communities. Closing down local banks will be a bitter blow for small communities and is best avoided."

column3: Bankaların kapanmasına izin verin."This is not the 1900s! The idea that we still need physical banks in the age of the Internet is ridiculous. Sooner or later all of our citizens will be comfortable with using the Internet. Besides
column4: is it really fair on the banks shareholders to somehow force them to keep money-losing branches open?"
"Festivities for the next Labor Day are being planned. Traditionally you would be giving a speech in front of the trade unions
column5: but you have also been invited to the opening ceremony of a new industrial complex by foreign investors
column6: that will strengthen the economy of the region and create many low income jobs."

column3: Sendikaların önünde konuşma yapın."Labor Day is the day of the working class and their trade unions
column4: holding a speech in front of them is a tradition and a big honor. Workers face many troubles in these insecure times and need to be reassured by the government that we are on their side and keeping their work places is a top priority."

column3: Yabancı yatırımcılara katılınWhile it is certainly important to tend to the needs of the trade unions
column4: it is also important to create more jobs and a key to that are foreign investors. Joining them will show our appreciation and will cause them and other countries to invest more here. We'll join the trade unions again next year."
"One of our longest serving military generals has died
column5: and you must decide whether to lay a wreath at his funeral. The general was definitely a military hero
column6: but was dogged by accusations of racism
column7: misogyny and bullying towards the end of his career."

column4: "In honoring the man at his funeral
column5: we are not condoning what he became later in life
column6: but simply paying respects to a man who was clearly prepared to put his life on the line for his country. Not to lay a wreath would be cheap virtue signaling that will insult our troops and disgrace the uniform they wear."

column4: The behavior of this man in the later part of his life cannot be excused, no matter what he did in his career. To be seen visibly honoring someone who behaved so badly simply shows contempt for ethnic minorities, women, and those he harassed and bullied. We must not be seen to support such behavior.
"Sex education in school is always a political football
column5: and now its back in play as the issue of educating children about the existence of same-sex couples and relationships has hit the news. You have to take a stand on whether or not to support LGBT topics in school lessons."

column4: "The whole point of school is to educate and prepare children for the real world
column5: and obviously same-sex relationships are part of society. Imagine the point of view of the child who questions their own sexuality. Surely its best for them to learn the truth from school teachers without pressure from religious leaders of parents with extreme views?"

column4: "Are children not overwhelmed and confused enough about sex and relationships without us introducing extreme liberal propaganda about gender fluidity into the mix? School is not the place to get bogged down in these issues
column5: and school-children are too young to be questioning their gender anyway."

column4: A large internet company has announced plans to buy out one of its main competitors. This merger needs government approval, but if it goes ahead it will create one of the biggest companies in the country.
"There is no good reason to prevent this merger. In an increasingly global market
column5: our companies need to grow if they are to compete successfully. The bigger company will be more efficient and effective in the global marketplace."

column4: "The whole idea of the free market is based on competition. Allowing these two firms to merge will reduce both competition
column5: and consumer choice and no doubt lead to redundancies. Its another example of government looking after big business and forgetting the little guy. Small businesses and trade unionists urge you to block this merger."

column4: Oil companies are keen to get permission to drill for oil in part of the country protected as a wildlife refuge. The oil supplies under the refuge are considerable but the drilling would have a negative impact on the environment.
"There are literally billions of barrels of oil right here on our soil
column5: and current law is preventing us from drilling for it. Instead
column6: we are importing oil from other countries. The environmental impact will be minimal when you consider the gains that drilling makes in terms of energy security. Nobody wants to spoil the environment
column7: but the alternative is reliance on foreign oil."

column4: "This valuable wildlife refuge would be devastated by oil exploration. This is one of our nations great national treasures
column5: and it would be criminal to wreck it just to boost domestic oil production. Drilling in this part of the country will not entirely remove our dependence on foreign oil
column6: but it will spoil our natural environment for future generations."

column4: "A large number of people have been caught entering our country hidden inside cargo containers
column5: in an organized attempt at people-smuggling. The criminals who masterminded the scheme have been arrested
column6: but there is debate as to whether those people who are now on our shores should be sent back to their country of origin."

column3: Bırak kalsınlar."There is strong evidence that these people were desperate to flee persecution
column4: poverty or even death in their own country. These are desperate people as we can see from the lengths they went to in order to get here. It would be inhumane to deport them now they are here."

column3: Onları sınır dışı edin."Letting these people stay would send out entirely the wrong signal to people who want to come here illegally. We have enough of a problem with illegal economic migrants as it is. Unfortunate though it may be
column4: the only sensible choice is to send them back."

"There are calls for a law to expressly set quotas for the employment of ethnic and other minorities by large corporations and government institutions. This would put pressure on companies to give higher priority to some job candidates than others on the basis of their race
column5: sex or age."

column4: "We need this law. In economic terms it makes no sense for people below or above a certain age to be rendered unemployable. Also
column5: in human rights terms
column6: this is much needed compensation for years of discrimination in the workplace against ethnic minorities
column7: women

column3: Yasayı reddet."This is a deeply flawed law. It makes no sense to fight discrimination by using discrimination. It creates two problems
column4: that of the minority members who feel they may not have achieved the position on merit
column5: and the resentment of the potential employee who was denied the job."

column4: "Angry citizens are protesting against a project to build power lines through their villages. These power lines are necessary to further increase use of renewable energy sources. Not building them would be an economic setback
column5: but if you ignore the citizens
column6: this will make then even angrier and supportive of their cause."

column3: Yine de elektrik hatları inşa et
column4: "Nobody wants power lines next to their houses
column5: but they have to be built somewhere. And until recently
column6: these people have been demanding more clean energy. The power lines will be built."

column4: "There are alternative ways to explore
column5: like underground power lines. And there are claims that the health of those living near power lines may be in danger. It is better to be safe than sorry."

column4: Much of our country is still privately owned, with access to walk on the land restricted by the landowners. There is a strong campaign to bring in laws forcing landowners to make their land accessible to ramblers and walkers to enjoy the countryside within certain guidelines.
"Private land is private land. This is the very basis of private ownership and capitalism. If the owners wish to restrict access to their land
column5: this is entirely up to them. This is nothing more than a thinly disguised class war attempt by disgruntled socialists."

column4: "It's crazy to have so much open and often entirely unused land in private hands while our cities are so overcrowded. This law will allow all citizens to enjoy the beauty of our countryside
column5: whilst retaining the final property rights and ownership privileges of the landowner. It's a good compromise."

column4: "As we build more houses in our country
column5: once open land that was used by walkers and hikers is increasingly becoming closed off and considered private property. Socialist campaigners have protested these changes and are calling for an expansion of protected 'public rights of way'."

column4: "Private land is private land
column5: regardless of whether it is farmland
column6: industrial land or somebody's garden or yard! The idea that because people have taken a certain path for many years that they should continue to have the right to trespass on private property is ridiculous. there are plenty of public roads and parks people can make use of."

column4: So much of our country is now private property that peoples access to open countryside is worryingly restricted. Does it really matter to a farmer if a few walkers and hikers occasionally cross their land on a designated footpath? We should ensure that open countryside and footpaths are easily accessible to everybody.
There are a number of suspected links between smoking and poor heath. Pressure groups have called for a ban on all smoking in public as an encouragement to smokers to give up.
This is a major step towards cutting the number of people in this country who die from smoking related illness. It is the duty of the state to pass laws like this in the interests of peoples health.

column3: Yasayı değiştirmeden bırakın."It's not the job of the state to tell people how they live their lives. This is a total over-reaction and an attack on civil liberties. Its legal to smoke
column4: so you should be free to do so in public. People must be free to make their own decisions about health."
"A recent court case
column5: where a rural man shot and killed a teenage burglar in his own home has thrown a spotlight on the law regarding reasonable force when defending property
column6: given that the homeowner was prosecuted for manslaughter."

column4: "Nobody has the right to take the life of another
column5: even if they are defending their property. Human life has to come before property
column6: in all cases. We may not have much sympathy for a burglar
column7: but allowing people to violently take the law into their own hands is certainly not the solution."

column4: "Its clearly ridiculous that a frightened man
column5: far from the police
column6: attacked by a violent criminal in his own home would ever be arrested
column7: let alone charged
column8: even if the criminal dies in the struggle. We need to clarify that every citizen has the right to use force to defend their property

column4: We should make it clear that the police will turn a blind eye to whatever means homeowners employ to defend themselves. If some burglar gets machinegunned in another persons kitchen, well thats just karma.

There is pressure for us to introduce a law to ban the wearing of religious symbols in state schools by students. This would include wearing the hijab by female Muslim students, and the wearing of a cross by Christian students.
"School is a place for children to learn
column5: not to display religious allegiance. By ensuring all students dress the same
column6: we can ensure there is equality and integration of all religions
column7: with no discrimination. This is the logical extension of the separation of religion and state. People are free to dress how they like in churches and mosques

column3: Yasağı reddet."This is nothing short of discrimination against Muslims. Nobody really expects this law to be used to prevent the wearing of Christian crosses
column4: it exists purely as an excuse to ban Muslim students from dressing as they wish. This will cause division and segregation
column5: and is a recipe for religious tension in schools."

column4: A prominent member of the royal family has been accused of spending a suspicious amount of time with a convicted sex offender, despite that individuals sordid history being well-known. This is being described as at-best 'poor judgement' and at worst, deeply suspicious. How will your government react?

"Nobody expects the government of the day to openly criticize the monarch. It would likely lead to major constitutional 'difficulties' and would be considered deeply unpatriotic. We should issue a statement that the allegations remain simply allegations
column5: and that this is merely guilt by association."

column4: How can we possibly stand by and let this happen without comment? Nobody expects your government to call for the royal families abolition, but at the very least a strongly worded statement to the effect that such behavior is 'unacceptable' would be appropriate, regardless of what the royalists and patriots may think.
"Weapons of mass destruction are theoretically a weapon of last resort
column5: and work purely as a deterrent. With this in mind
column6: there is pressure for you to publicly commit to no first-use of any such weapons."

column4: "This is simply a public way to re-iterate our purpose in possessing such weapons. We do not have any expansionary plans
column5: so clearly such weapons exist purely as a form of defense
column6: by deterring foreign aggression. This is also a way to encourage others to make the same claim
column7: and could lead to less international tension and a safer world."

column4: "It would be crazy for us to tie the hands of our military by announcing our strategy to the world for all to see. It is clear that our potential enemies are in no rush to make similar grandstanding announcements. If they want to rule out first strikes
column5: let them go first. We should be in no such rush."

column4: Representatives from oil companies based in our country have requested that the government deploy troops overseas at our oil refineries in the middle east to protect them from attack by terrorists. The governments involved are happy for our troops to be stationed on their soil for this purpose.

column3: Askerleri gönderin."This is why we have a military
column4: and we should not be afraid to use it. Foreign terrorists need to understand that we are prepared to take determined action to safeguard our oil supplies. This is not a 'foreign invasion'
column5: merely the provision of extra security for vital parts of our industry that happen to be overseas. If we do not deploy troops
column6: the oil supply *will* suffer."

column3: Asker göndermeyin."It doesn't matter what our motivation is
column4: the symbolism of our troops landing on foreign soil
column5: heavily armed and prepared to use deadly force
column6: is going to cause a major backlash in some countries. Its likely this will lead to both problems with international relations and the possibility of increased terrorism. Our troops are not the security wing of the oil companies
column7: and this is no job for them."

column4: A number of large corporations have expressed an interest in investing in our school system. Everything from free schoolbooks to entire sports centers is offered in return for some branding and promotional opportunities.

It would be crazy to turn down the offer of free educational materials. The government cannot provide the state of the art facilities that these companies are prepared to build in our schools. Having company logos on school books is a trivial price to pay for such large investment in education.

Our schools are places for kids to be educated, not to be brainwashed in buying this or that brand of cola. Advertising is everywhere in society and schools are one of the last places we can escape from it. Keep big business out of education!
"Traditionally
column5: paid leave from work was for the mother only
column6: but there is a proposal to make this shared so that the time can be split between both parents as they fit. This is seen as a step towards gender equality."

column4: "There is simply no need for this. It only complicates the provision of parental leave
column5: and the overwhelming majority of parents agree that the mother is the best person to take time off work to look after a new born child. This is nothing more than pandering to an agenda that tries to pretend there is no difference between the genders."

column4: "It makes perfect sense these days that which parent claims the amount of paid leave after having a new child is left to the parents
column5: rather than being determined by the state. We no longer live in a world where all parenting is done by the mother
column6: and the current system is simply a sexist legacy of outdated points of view."

column4: "Shock at the amount of plastic pollution in our water-supply
column5: our oceans
column6: and even in the air we breath has led to calls from scientists to ban single-use plastics entirely to get the problem of plastic pollution under control."

column4: "Its absolutely ridiculous that we allow companies to use plastic packaging that will be used only once but will take maybe hundreds of years to break down
column5: and even then may end up in our water supply. Other materials are available
column6: and only government legislation will persuade companies to do the right thing and swap to more sustainable products."

column4: "This sounds like an easy crowd-pleasing change
column5: but the impact on industry would be massive. Like it or not
column6: we have got used to the idea of cheap
column7: single use plastic in many parts of our life. A ban would cause immense costs and regulatory hell for our small businesses and be an economic nightmare. Meanwhile foreign companies will use them as normal."

column4: A major motorist's pressure group has lobbied government to get the speed limits on our major roads raised. These speed limits were set many years ago and both car speeds and braking performance has improved since then.
"We have moved on since the times when men walked with red flags in front of motor cars. The national speed limits are stupidly low
column5: and the limits are widely ignored. We cannot enforce the limits effectively
column6: and until the limits are set as sensible values its just encouraging people to break the law. We need to raise the limits immediately."

column4: "Speed limits exist for a reason. Enough people die on our roads as it is
column5: and speed is often a factor in the survivability of car accidents. Its true people break the limit as it is
column6: but raising it now will just encourage faster
column7: dangerous driving. Leave it unchanged."

column4: "A large empty house in one of the best neighborhoods of the capital has been taken over by homeless people. The house has been unused and empty for years
column5: and lawyers are now arguing over whether or not the 'squatters' have a right to remain in the property. The landlord wishes to have them evicted."

column3: Gecekondulara mal verin."If people have become so wealthy that they can own multiple houses and leave some empty
column4: whilst meanwhile we have some citizens with nowhere to live
column5: then it is only right and fair that these homes be put to good use. The landlord has obviously had no need of the property for many years and it should be now legally given to the occupiers."

column4: "Its a dangerous precedent if you effectively hand someone's property to thieves. If the owner is wealthy enough to have empty properties
column5: then this is his decision. Nobody is preventing these 'squatters' from saving up and buying a house legally just like the landlord did. Send in the police and throw these people out."

column4: There are demands from the police for the power to stop and search people on the street if they believe that individual may be guilty of a crime. Currently our police cannot search someone without formally arresting them.
"This will be a valuable weapon in the fight against crime and should have a noticeable impact on violent and street crime especially. If our citizens have nothing to hide
column5: then they have nothing to fear from this law."

column3: Değişmeden bırakın."This is a very dangerous move. Its wide open to abuse on racial grounds
column4: and will further distance the police from the community. Our citizens should be free to go about their lawful business without interference from the authorities!"
"A popular internet streamer is offering to sing for you on your birthday in public. She is known for her tiny dresses and adult themed songs
column5: making her very popular among young people."

column4: This is a great honor and will help you gain popularity with young people all over the country. Let's just hope it's cold and she wears something less revealing than usual.
"She may be famous and successful
column5: but clearly is not a role model for our youth. Let's keep this celebration small and decent
column6: and focus on the important political issues."

column4: "There are calls to toughen up the driving test regime to ensure new drivers are much better prepared for road conditions
column5: and to improve driver safety."

column4: "The current driving test may have been fine when cars went 20mph and before six lane highways existed
column5: but times have changed. Drivers are increasingly distracted by mobile phones
column6: and can drive staggeringly fast vehicles in all weather conditions with virtually no experience. For the sake of the many children run over and killed each year
column7: we need tougher tests."

column4: "There is no need for change. If anything
column5: cars are getting safer each year thanks to modern technology such as collision detection and crash-safety systems. It already costs a fortune and takes forever to pass a driving test. This would just be a burden for new young drivers."

column4: "Street protests are taking place in a foreign country with historical ties to us. We do a lot of profitable trade with this country
column5: but their government is authoritarian and we face pressure to openly support the cause of the street protesters."

column3: Protestocuları destekleyin."Do we believe in democracy or not? This should not be complicated. If the government is showing authoritarian tendencies
column4: and we believe the protesters have a point
column5: then we should stand by our principles and back them
column6: not keep quiet because it earns us money in trade deals to look the other way."

column4: We would be angered if we faced protesters in our streets (as all democracies do) and foreign leaders started openly backing the protesters against our government. It would be terrible for our diplomatic relations with this trading partner if we took the side of the relatively small number of protesters in the streets.

Terrorists in the middle east have started to attack vital pipelines owned by our companies, and which indirectly provide us with fuel. In order to protect our oil supply, the army would like to start surgical strikes on carefully selected targets.

Terrorism is a real threat and rising oil prices limit growth. We have the means to disrupt terrorist operations without risking the lives of our soldiers. We have to strike now and prevent those terrorists from getting the upper hand.
"The troubles in that area have economical and social reasons
column5: that can not be solved by bombing terrorist leaders. A ground war and subsequent rebuilding are a more costly but far more effective way to solve the problems of this region."

column4: The united nations is pushing for your country to sign a treaty that would ban us from carrying out any nuclear weapons tests for research purposes. Many other nations have already signed the treaty and are pressuring us to sign through diplomatic channels.

column3: Antlaşmayı imzalayın."We have no real need to carry out further tests
column4: it's not like the current generation of weapons do not work
column5: or are not powerful enough. Signing the treaty will keep environmental campaigners happy and will raise our popularity on the international stage."

column3: Antlaşma imzalamayın."It's vital that we retain the right to carry out limited testing. We live in a dangerous world and our nuclear deterrent is vital to our defense. It's not for other nations to tell us how to defend ourselves. Besides
column4: testing is required to ensure our weapons still remain usable."
"Police officers have arrested a con-man who is a staying in our country illegally. Under normal circumstances
column5: he would be eligible to be deported back to his country of origin. The man claims that if sent back to his homeland
column6: it is likely he will be tortured by the government."

column3: Onu sınır dışı edin."This man has nobody to blame for his situation but himself. He arrived here illegally
column4: and has operated as a criminal since he got here. If he had claimed political asylum when he arrived and not began a life of crime it would be a different matter. In the circumstances we must take his claims of torture threats with a pinch of salt."
"It's clear that this man is hardly a model citizen
column5: but no confidence trickster deserves to be tortured. If we truly oppose the use of torture on principle
column6: then despite the mans history
column7: we need to ensure we are not willing participants to torture by sending him back home. If we deport him
column8: it could effectively become a death sentence."

column4: "A proposal has been put forward to construct a major toxic waste dump in our country. This facility will be very large
column5: potentially creating many jobs in its construction
column6: but there are concerns about its effect on the environment."

column4: "Nobody exactly WANTS toxic waste in their back garden
column5: but we would be fools to turn our backs on the economic gains from setting up this facility
column6: not to mention the potential jobs. Besides
column7: we can place the dump in the countryside where the jobs are needed and the risks are low."

column4: "It doesn't matter how many jobs and how much money is involved
